key_insight: AuditDM trains an MLLM as an automated auditor (via reinforcement learning) that generates challenging questions and counterfactual images to maximally expose differences between models, then uses those divergences to guide targeted fixes.
problem_solved: Conventional evaluation of multimodal LLMs is often opaque and misses important capability gaps; AuditDM actively discovers interpretable failure modes by forcing models to disagree so practitioners can diagnose and fix them.
method: Fine-tune an MLLM as an auditor with reinforcement learning to generate hard prompts and counterfactual images that aim to maximize disagreement among target models.
Measure and cluster inter-model divergences to surface distinct failure modes and produce interpretable examples that highlight where models differ.
Use discovered disagreements to drive rectification (e.g., targeted data augmentation or model fine-tuning) that closes capability gaps.
impact: Provides a scalable, interpretable way to audit and improve multimodal models—enabling targeted debugging, safer deployment, and more robust model comparison beyond scalar benchmarks.
visual_elements: Pipeline flowchart: Auditor (MLLM + RL) → generates prompts/images → multiple target models → disagreement detection → rectification loop
Disagreement heatmap/table: per-task or per-example agreement scores across models highlighting hotspots
Before/after examples: original image and auditor-generated counterfactual with model responses showing divergence and corrected behavior after rectification
Bar chart: reduction in disagreement or error rates pre- and post-rectification for each target model
paper_title: Differences That Matter: Auditing Models for Capability Gap Discovery and Rectification
paper_authors: Qihao Liu, Chengzhi Mao, Yaojie Liu, Alan Yuille, Wen-Sheng Chu
